creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: interior view of temple structure; large red paper lantern hangs from the ceiling between supports near center; other smaller, white lanterns also suspended from ceiling; a few visitors touring the building, including a woman in blue kimono lower center who appears to gaze up to the lantern
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, and Seal

Inscription L margin, printed: [自刻　昭和二十一年作　石山寺]  {Jikoku, Shōwa nijūichinen saku, Ishiyamadera}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
signed: Signature LRC of print: [遠志] (Tōshi); signed in pencil LRC: [Toshi Yoshida]; title printed bottom L: [Ishiyama Temple]
title: Ishiyama Temple
